action.action-desc: Mrs. Ellmers (for herself, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, and Ms. Eddie Bernice Johnson of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To ensure that the Ryan White Comprehensive AIDS Resources Emergency Act program is as effective as possible in saving lives and preventing the spread of the HIV epidemic by ensuring that funding allocations are evidenced-based and by promoting greater utilization of patient-centered care.

subsection.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Ryan White Patient Equity and Choice Act
.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

section.header: Prioritization of evidence-based funding allocations to address the continuum of HIV care

subsection.header: Ensuring funding is prioritized for areas where the HIV epidemic is growing
subsection.text: Part E of title XXVI of the Public Health Service Act is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating section 2689 of such Act ( 42 U.S.C. 300ff–88 ) as section 2689C; and
by inserting after section 2688 of such Act ( 42 U.S.C. 300ff–87a ) the following:

section.header: General provisions on the distribution of grants
section.text: Not later than September 30, 2014, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: submit to Congress a report on whether the allocation of funding under the parts of this title enables areas where the HIV epidemic is growing to meet the need for medical services; and
include in such report a plan to ensure that—

subparagraph.text: rural areas with limited public transportation are able to expand the use of medical transportation services for eligible individuals in need of such services; and
the level of funds under parts A and B of this title in any State, per living individual with HIV/AIDS, does not vary by more than 5 percent relative to such total level in any other State.

subsection.header: Enhancing treatment adherence through the provision of pharmaceutical services
subsection.text: Section 2616 of the Public Health Service Act ( 42 U.S.C. 300ff–26 ) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Enhancing Treatment Adherence Through the Provision of Pharmaceutical Services

paragraph.text: In providing therapeutics pursuant to this section, a State shall offer pharmaceutical services through extensive pharmacy networks, including specialty pharmacies and pharmacies that focus on the HIV population.
A pharmacy network under paragraph (1) shall not be limited to a single retail chain.
Pharmaceutical services provided pursuant to paragraph (1) may include mail order services, but only if—

subparagraph.text: such mail order services are optional; and
the patient continues to be able to choose the services of a community or other in-person pharmacist instead of mail order services.

paragraph.text: whether the funding will promote the incorporation of the principles of patient-centered care, as described in subsection (f)(5), into the provision of support services under this title.
by adding at the end the following:

Of the amount used under subsection (a) for a fiscal year, the Secretary shall use the greater of $5,000,000 or an amount equal to 20 percent of such amount, but not to exceed $7,000,000, to award grants to one or more States for patient-centered model of care projects.
Projects funded under this subsection shall—

subparagraph.text: facilitate patient choice in the utilization of eligible services by eligible individuals through the use of Ryan White Savings Accounts described in paragraph (3);
provide for patient-based evaluation of service providers.
Services provided under this subsection for eligible individuals shall be funded through individual savings accounts—

clause.text: to be known as Ryan White Savings Accounts; and
to be established and overseen by the State receiving the grant for the project involved.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall ensure that each Ryan White Savings Account meets the following:

clause.text: Eligible individuals, with appropriate coordination with their care providers, have discretion to choose the eligible services to be funded through the Account.
Each account shall be used exclusively for the purpose of paying for eligible services.
The balance of each Account shall remain available for obligation until such time as—

subclause.text: the individual is no longer eligible to receive services; or
the project which relates to such Account terminates.

clause.text: If an individual’s Account becomes unavailable for obligation because the individual is no longer eligible for services, or because the project terminates, as described in clause (iii), the Secretary shall make the remaining balance in the Account available for other projects under this subsection.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection:

subparagraph.text: An individual is eligible to participate in a project under this subsection and receive services through the project if the individual is eligible to receive services under any provision of this title other than this subsection.
The term eligible services, with respect to an eligible individual, means—

clause.text: core medical services (as defined in section 2604(c)(3));
pharmaceutical services described in section 2616(h); and
the following 2 types of support services:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall work to ensure that, where appropriate, projects funded under this section adhere to the following principles:

subparagraph.text: HIV care is customized and reflects patient needs, values, and choices.
Patient safety is a visible priority.
Transparency is the rule in the care of the patient.
The patient is the source of control for their care.
All caregivers cooperate with one another through a common focus on the best interests and personal goals of the patient.

paragraph.text: Each State receiving a grant under this subsection shall—

subparagraph.text: conduct a survey on patient satisfaction with services provided pursuant to the grant; and
report the results of the survey to the Secretary.

paragraph.text: In this subsection:

subparagraph.text: The term case management services means advice and assistance in obtaining medical, social, community, legal, financial, and other needed services.
The term medical transportation services means conveyance services provided, directly or through a voucher, to a patient to enable him or her to access health care services.

subsection.text: Part E of title XXVI of the Public Health Service Act ( 42 U.S.C. 300ff–81 et seq. ) is amended by inserting after section 2689A, as added by section 3, the following:

section.header: General provisions on the promotion of patient-centered care

subsection.text: Not later than September 30, 2014, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a proposed plan to incorporate the principles of HIV patient-centered care described in section 2691(f)(5) into the provision of services under all parts of this title.
The plan under subsection (a) shall, at a minimum, include the following:

paragraph.text: An assessment of current grantees’ utilization of patient-centered care across all services provided under all parts of this title.
An analysis of—

subparagraph.text: existing models of patient-centered care, including the projects funded under section 2691(f); and
the feasibility of implementing these models throughout programs and services funded under this title.
